properties.areaDesc: Crawford; Vermilion; Clark; Richland; Clay; Champaign; Effingham; Edgar; Douglas; Jasper; Lawrence; Cumberland; Coles
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 9 at 2:30PM CST until January 11 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...Heavy Rains Expected Friday afternoon into Saturday across
Central and Southeast Illinois...

The Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of east central Illinois and southeast Illinois,
including the following areas, in east central Illinois,
Champaign, Clark, Coles, Cumberland, Douglas, Edgar, and
Vermilion. In southeast Illinois, Clay, Crawford, Effingham,
Jasper, Lawrence, and Richland.

* From Friday afternoon through 3 PM Saturday afternoon

* Widespread rain showers will develop across the area during
tonight and continue into Saturday. Heavier rain will move in
from the southwest during Friday afternoon and evening, and
continue into Saturday afternoon with thunderstorms possible.
Widespread rain totals of 3 to 4 inches, with locally higher
amounts, are possible especially with thunderstorms.

* These forecast rain amounts could lead to flooding of low lying
areas which could impact some roads. In addition, urban flooding
is possible, especially where storm drains are obstructed. Rises
on area rivers and streams are possible, which may lead to
flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts. Monitor later forecasts and be alert for
possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding
should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
